title: On riscv64gc linux, split-debuginfo ="unpacked" caused error: A dwo section may not contain relocations

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Problem

On riscv64gc linux, split-debuginfo ="unpacked" caused error: A dwo section may not contain relocations.

- For rust > 1.64, this error occurs.
- For rust <=1.64, cargo didn't pass `-C split-debuginfo=unpacked` flag to rustc.
  - For rust 1.64, a segmentation fault happens in rustc.
  - For rust < 1.64, it builds fine

I think the behavior of rust < 1.64 is correct.

### Steps

The following steps:

```bash
cargo new failure
cd failure
echo "[profile.dev]" >> Cargo.toml
echo 'split-debuginfo = "unpacked"' >> Cargo.toml
cargo build
```

caused the following failure:

```bash
Compiling failure v0.1.0 (/root/failure)
error: A dwo section may not contain relocations

error: could not compile `failure` due to previous error
```

### Possible Solution(s)

_No response_

### Notes

Related: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/56642

### Version

```text
cargo 1.67.1 (8ecd4f20a 2023-01-10)
release: 1.67.1
commit-hash: 8ecd4f20a9efb626975ac18a016d480dc7183d9b
commit-date: 2023-01-10
host: riscv64gc-unknown-linux-gnu
libgit2: 1.5.0 (sys:0.16.0 vendored)
libcurl: 7.86.0-DEV (sys:0.4.59+curl-7.86.0 vendored ssl:OpenSSL/1.1.1q)
os: Linux [64-bit]
```
